abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Third Economic
            Governance and Recovery Grant Project for Togo were as
            follows: outcomes were satisfactory; the risk to development
            outcome was moderate; the Bank's performance was
            satisfactory; and the Borrower's performance was also
            satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: the fact that
            policy reforms in the prior actions were embedded in the
            Government's own reform agenda and closely aligned with
            two major pillars of the full Poverty Reduction Strategy
            Paper (PRSP), led to strong ownership of the reforms. Given
            the generally limited capacity within the public sector in
            fragile countries such as Togo, it was important to be
            selective in the choice of policy and institutional reforms.
            It is important to carefully choose prior actions that are
            likely to open the door for other important policy and
            institutional reforms. The effectiveness of Bank-supported
            development policy operations can be enhanced by its
            complementarities with other Bank-financed operation and the
            efforts of other active donors in the reform areas.
